events.name: Future Of Money
events.description:
Lets take a deep dive in to world of Crypto-currencies and understand how it will change the way we Live, Work & Play. For this talk, we are putting together a panel of Crypto-currency experts, BitCoin entreprenuers, Financial Technology Entreprenuers to help us to take a peek in to that future. 
Our guest speakers for the event is confirmed. Please see below. 
1.  David Moskowitz – David founded Coin Republic to help educate the public about Bitcoin and create a platform to help them buy and sell Bitcoin easily. In June 2013, he launched an online Autobuy system, which allows clients to use their Singapore iBanking accounts to quickly purchase Bitcoin and send them directly to their wallets. He is a well known Singapore evangelist for Bitcoin and local Bitcoin businesses and has helped to promote Singapore as a Bitcoin hub to the wider world. David will be presenting an overview of how Bitcoin and it's blockchain works, followed by explaining the disruption bitcoin is bringing in a wide range of markets and services (beyond a currency). 
2.  Ravi Patel – Ravi has over 10 years of experience in the Financial Services industry undertaking roles in Strategy, Business and Product Development across Europe and Asia.  Most recently he was the Strategy & Execution manager for the CEO Office in Singapore, Barclays, Wealth & Investment Management.  Prior to this he did a similar role for Credit Suisse for their European businesses after being responsible for Capital Markets & Banking research for Accenture, Growth and Strategy division.  Ravi will be presenting his ideas on the future of digital money in an evolved centralised fiat monetary system which may not involve cryptocurrencies.  He will also discuss Open Access banking platforms and related security issues, as well as give a take on the worldwide QE trend.
events.location: IDA Labs @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Rd, #03-04, Singapore 188969

events.name: SoftLayer Presents Joel Gascoigne, CEO and Co-Founder at Buffer in Singapore
events.description:
Hey Everyone, 
  
SoftLayer Presents Joel Gascoigne, CEO and Co-Founder at Buffer in Singapore 
  
Joel Gascoigne, CEO and Co-Founder at Buffer (www.bufferapp.com) is in SINGAPORE! It is extremely rare for a Silicon Valley founder to be dropping by Singapore and SoftLayer is honored to be hosting him for a knowledge sharing session. It is amazing to see how he has scaled his profitable business from 0 to 5MM ARR in 4 years using a remote workforce and we will be learning the lessons he has gained from this startup journey. Buffer makes it incredibly simple for individuals and businesses to publish content to social media networks. Buffer team consist of 29 people spread all across the world.Till date, Buffer has raised a total of $3.5M in funding and is currently valued at $60M based on last funding round. We are happy to have Gwen, Business Development and Community Growth at Tech in Asia to be moderating the fireside chat with Joel. 
  
About Joel 
Since starting Buffer from my bedroom in the UK, it's been incredibly fun to build it into a powerful social media tool used by hundreds of thousands of people. We're also trying to create one of the most interesting and fulfilling places to work, so I spend a lot of my time thinking about company culture. My work is split between growing the company and working with the team on all areas of product, engineering and customer happiness. I also love to exercise, travel, and help other startup founders. 
  
About Gwen 
Based in Singapore, Gwen is an entrepreneur, investor and community leader focused on technology startups in Asia. She built and sold SGEntrepreneurs to Tech in Asia, where she continues to track innovation in some of the world's largest markets. Prior to that, she ran a seed fund which invested in Padlet (YC alum), iHipo (acquired), LunchActually, and which has seen three exits to date. Gwen has lived in Singapore, Vietnam, and the US, given talks across Asia, Europe and the US, speaks 3.25 languages, loves physics, travelling, dance and adventure sports. 
During the fireside chat, Joel will cover the following topics: 

Hiring
Building Culture
Rewarding Employees
Transparency
Raising Funds
Scaling Business 
Key Saas Metrics to look out for

Agenda


1800-1845: Registration and Networking
1845-1930: Fireside Chat with Joel Gascoigne moderated by Gwendolyn Regina Tan 
1930-2000: QnA Session
2000-2030: Dinner and Networking


 
Special Thanks to NUS Enterprise and Plug-In@BLK 71 for sponsoring the venue.
 

About SoftLayer
 
Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, SoftLayer delivers world-class, on-demand virtual data center services on a global basis from facilities located in Dallas, Singapore, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Sydney. SoftLayer integrates all facets of IT to innovate industry-leading solutions that are fully automated.
 
About SoftLayer Team Catalyst Program
 

 
SoftLayer's Catalyst Startup Program was created to help early-stage startups supercharge their business within a 12-month incubator program that offers free best-in-class marketing and technical support, hosting, and mentoring. Lucas Chua manages the APAC region and frequently travel to startup hubs to help accelerate startups.
events.location: Plugin-In@BLK 71 Managed by NUS Enterprise, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-18, Singapore 139951
events.group_name: SoftLayer Team Catalyst APAC - Lucas Chua

events.name: DataScience SG Meetup- Jan
events.description: Hi everyone, happy new year to all of you from us organizing committees at DataScience SG. We look forward to a fruitful and exciting 2015 with all you. To start off the year, we have lined up 2 speakers in our January meetup =) 7.15 pm: Networking (BYOR- Bring Your Own Refreshments =) 7.30 pm: Nicholas Jachowski (linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/nicholas-jachowski/b/937/805 ) • Title: Uncertainty based predictive model development 8:00 pm: Sutowo Wong (linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sutowo ) • Title: Common Misconceptions in Analytics • Synopsis: When it comes to learning about Analytics, most people think of classroom training. The value of getting your hands dirty and especially learning from mistakes is often overlooked. The presentation that you see is often the result of many rounds of scrubbing. The speaker will share some of the common mistakes that he has observed and provide a glimpse of the working drafts before they were scrubbed and polished. He will also talk about the critical success factors that will make or break Analytics implementation. 8:30 pm: Closing and networking. More details on the talk will be updated. Stay tuned to our meetup page.
events.location: SMU School of Economics and Social Science, Seminar Room 5.2 (lift access only), Singapore Management University

events.name: January Meetup
events.description: Happy 2015! May it be full of new Ruby goodness, great people and hot pizza. Rather coincidentally, you can find all of that at our first meetup of 2015 this January 27th at 7pm. Venue: Microsoft Singapore, Level 21 Auditorium, One Marina Boulevard See you there! -------------- 1. Elisha Tan - Why I organise Rails Girls 2. TBC 3. 5 Random Enumerators Tips - Grzegorz Witek / @arnvald * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minute session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com. See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. 90 Seconds Are you a seasoned Rubyist with technical leadership experience? 90 Seconds is a tech company in the cloud video production space. We're a young, innovative start-up, now operating in 5 countries globally looking for a CTO to take us to the next level! More information found here: http://90seconds.workable.com/jobs/31582 -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food: ThoughtWorks Venue and Drinks: Microsoft (Singapore)
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Innovation. Not infrastructure.
events.description: Happy 2015 everyone! The first meetup of the year is here! We are combining the meetup this month with a Google Cloud Platform event around staying agile with infrastructure and adapt to changes happening in the space. Below are the talks scheduled for the event 1. 'Fat-free Compute Infrastructure' - a talk around Apache Mesos by Abhishek Parolkar, Head of Technology @ PropertyGuru 2. 'Warehouse Style Computing, Working with Custers as an abstraction' a talk about containerisation and Kubernetes by Karthikyan Rajasekharan, Technical Lead @ Google Cloud Platform Asia 3. You? ************ Call for speaker ************ There is a 20 minutes slot available for a talk around similar topic like containerization. Ping us at sagarwal@thoughtworks.com or tth@thoughtworks.com. ************ Job Postings ************ If you are looking for people, message us a blurb (keep it short please) and a link to your job posting and we will put it here. 1. ThoughtWorks ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We are dedicated to the art of perfecting software delivery by keeping it lightweight, fast-moving and open-source. Our clients are people and organisations with ambitious missions - whether in the commercial, social, or government sectors. They trust us to deliver the disruptive thinking and technology that empowers them to succeed. We are currently looking for talented people in Singapore/ASEAN who are equally as passionate about software. If you are someone who loves the idea of helping the technical community locally to grow then we want to talk to you! https://jobs.thoughtworks.com/singapore/JobDetail/Singapore-Singapore-Software-Developers/897 P.S. Please carry an ID to exchange for a pass at the reception to gain access to the building. Thank you to Google for providing the venue and food/drinks.
events.location: Google Singapore, 8 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 1 Level 30

events.name: It's 2015 let's start something - GeekGirl Meetup Launch and Startup Stories from Singapore
events.description:
It's 2015 - let's start something 
  
Geek Girl Meetup Launch Event:  
Startup Stories from Singapore 
  
28 January, 2015 | 6.30pm - 9.30 pm | The Working Capitol 
  
Geek Girl Meetup, the global community for women intrested in tech, code, startups and design is launching in Singapore in 2015. We've invited speakers to help inspire us to make this year about change and starting something new, whether it’s your own business, a new hobby, learning a new language or learning how to code. 
We proudly present our confirmed speakers. 
Grace Clapham 
 Founder of The Change School. 
 
  
Jiawen Ngeow  
Founder of Megafash, a market place for independent brands 
 
  
Elisha Tan 
Founder of Learnemy, an online marketplace for in-person classes 
 
 The event is hosted by the newest and hottest co-working space in Singapore The Working Capitol. 
 

  
Why should you attend? 
GeekGirl Meetup aim to highlight female role models by inviting them to take the stage and share their expertise, knowledge and inspire others to learn new skills with the focus on tech and business. 
A Geek Girl Meetup is all about meeting other likeminded girls and women to team up with to start working on fun and intresting projects.  
The GeekGirl community was founded in Sweden in 2008 and has from there spread to Denmark, Germany, Mexico, the US, the UK, and Hong Kong. The Geek Girl Singapore team currently consists of Erica Hanson, Katie Evans and Magdalena Krön. If you're intrested in getting involved send us an e-mail on geekgirlmeetupsg@gmail.com. 
Follow us us on twitter and like us on Facebook. 
geekgirlmeetup.com | Geek Girl Meetup Global geekgirlmeetup.co.uk | GeekGirl Meetup UK
events.location: The Working Capitol, 1 Keong Saik road, Singapore 089109

events.name: .NET Developers Meetup #2 : Developing Web
events.description: Hi .NETers, We will have our second .NET Developers Community Singapore meetup. Please join this meetup. There will be .NET news, coding, etc. sharing from the community and expert as well. We are very excited that this meet up will be at held at The Colony at *SCAPE, our Programme Partner. Direction : If you are using a bus, you can alight at Nat'l Youth Council bus stop (bus number: 7, 14, 16, 36, 65, 77, 106, 111, 123, 174, 174e, 175, 971E) and just cross the road. If you are using MRT, you can alight at Somerset MRT station (NS23) first and 5 minutes walk to the venue. Nearby landmark: Cineleisure Orchard . AGENDA • Latest news on .NET Open Source (open floor sharing). Try .NET... • Setting up ASP.NET MVC . See how you prepare setting up ASP.NET MVC. Migrating packages.config to project.json for server packages, using bower instead of nuget to fetch client libraries, using grunt instead of build script to compile typescript and less and to run JavaScript unit test, setting up MVC, Web API and SignalR and using Kestrel to run the application on a Linux VM. - by Nguyen Quy Hy • Dependency Injection with .NET MVC/WebAPI . Dependency injection is a powerful and fundamental software design pattern to building loosely coupled, highly unit testable software. Explore the 3 main ways of dependency injection (Constructor, Setter, Interface) and look at a simple and practical approach towards implementing IoC for any .NET MVC/WEB API project. - by Donovan Huang • Creating your own website using ASP.NET MVC 5 + AngularJS from 0 to go live . You can just learn or you can follow to create the website and add public domain name. I buy the domain from Namecheap.com , quite cheap only $3.98 per year. The presentation is fully step-by-step walk through, so by the end of the presentation, your own website will go live. You can update your own website easily from Visual Studio. I'm going to use angulargo template to create the website or someones template if more interesting. You need to bring your laptop if you want to follow me step-by-step. - by Riza What else... • Food will be available, thanks to from Microsoft Singapore. • YES!!! the Door Prize from unnamed sponsor for one lucky member, is this WD for you...???
events.location: *SCAPE The Colony, #04-01, 2 Orchard Link, Singapore 237978

events.name: Servant: The minimalist webservice framework in Haskell
events.description: This is the second talk in January. We are happy to invite Julian Arni and Sönke Hahn to talk about their minimalist webservice framework in Haskell. # About Talk Servant is a new Haskell framework for webservices that reduces boilerplate to a bare minimum, using a type-level representation of routes to achieve greater modularity, flexibility and type-safety. Julian Arni and Sönke Hahn , two of the three original authors, will explain how to use servant, as well as the principles behind its design. # About Speakers, in alphabetical order - Julian Arni: https://github.com/jkarni - Sönke Hahn: https://github.com/soenkehahn
events.location: The Office, 75A Pagoda Street Singapore 059234

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm ArtScience Museum Lobby The full line-up of ArtScience Late until January 2015 can be viewed here:http://bit.ly/artsciencelate For one evening a month, ArtScience Museum transforms into a night-time platform for artists in the fields of performance and new media to experiment, explore, discover and challenge their artistic boundaries. Come to a space where interaction, collaboration and experimentation are de rigueur of the night, and chill out with music and our bar overlooking Marina Bay. Hypermnesia 8pm & 9pm featuring Composit formed by Shunsuke Francois Nanjo (Japan/France), Kensuke Christophe Nanjo (Japan/France) and Nicolas Charbonnier (France) in collaboration with Eisa Jocson (The Philippines) The installation Hypermnesia is the result of artists and an aeronautical engineer working together. The team has developed for this unique occasion an interactive pole installation for the internationally celebrated choreographer/performer Eisa Jocson. The artwork will react to her body heat and movement, and the audience is also invited to interact with the artwork through touch, altering the sound in the background. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Correlation between IT and Sales by Charmain Tan
events.description: We all know that sales is important to every startup’s survival. Join us this Friday to find out how Charmain hybrids IT and Sales and how she manages the twist between Sales People and Engineers? In addition, you will also get to hear more about how IT can help you increase your sales systematically for a tech company. Speaker Bio: Who would think that a exchange student would develop a winter product after just being on exchange in a winter country. But 3 years back, Charmain Tan did so. She invented and commercialized a winter touchscreen gloves as she could not use her newly bought iphone in the midst of the winter. It was indeed a great innovation as validated by the various international awards (eg. Red Dot Design Award, International Invention Award-Gold) that her company acclaimed for the invention. But great innovation needs to be coupled with great sales for the growth of a company. Hence as she was enroute to starting her second, she wanted to build something that could help companies increase their sales so entrepreneurs would not walk the same path that she did. Together with some great partners who are talented at Sales, Operations and Technology respectively, she started her second earlier this year Register Now! Sign up now to listen to how this young and crazy lady blend sales and technology in her new startup, developed a market-ready product in 2 months & scale it to profitability in less than 6 months.
events.location: Plug-In@Blk71

events.name: "A Quantum City: How to Master the Generic?" @Urban Lab
events.description:
What if cities were not connected in space and time? A discussion on how current information technologies will allow us to deal with the complexity of global urbanisation and what it means to talk about a city in informational terms. 
  
FAQs 
1. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
By public transport, the nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. Please use Exit A and walk along Peck Seah Street.  
By car, you may park at the URA East Wing car park. Please use the lift to access the link bridge on the second floor. Follow the signs for Singapore City Gallery, and take the escalator to the first floor.    
2. Is my invitation transferrable? 
Yes, in the event that you are unable to attend you may nominate someone to take your place. Please kindly inform the organisers. 
3. Do I have to bring my printed invitation to the event? 
No, you do not need to bring your invitation to the event.
events.location: Urban Redevelopment Authority, The URA Centre, 45 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069118
events.group_name: Urban Redevelopment Authority and Singapore-ETH Centre

By car, you may park at the URA East Wing car park. Please use the lift to access the link bridge on the second floor. Follow the signs for Singapore City Gallery, and take the escalator to the first floor.    
2. Is my invitation transferrable? 
Yes, in the event that you are unable to attend you may nominate someone to take your place. Please kindly inform the organisers. 
3. Do I have to bring my printed invitation to the event?

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (January)
events.description: First Rails Girls of the year! Join us to pick up a new skill. Rails Girls meetup is an avenue to introduce women to the wonderful language of Ruby and the awesome framework, Ruby on Rails. Learning how to program might seem daunting (it really isn't) but don't worry, we are here to help you along. Instead of a fixed curriculum delivered classroom-style, Rails Girls meetup gives you the flexibility to choose what you want to do. There will be coaches around to answer any problems you have. If you have no idea where to start, we'll guide you through that too! (And yes, everything is hands-on.) Here are some suggestions of what you can choose to do: 1. Install Rails in your computer 2. Continue with your work on the Rails Girls app and perhaps follow some of the additional guides on http://guides.railsgirls.com/app/ , 3. Do the RailsBridge curriculum at http://docs.railsbridge.org/intro-to-rails/ 4. Work on your own project/learning material Please choose one of the options above when you RVSP. ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please drop us an email at elisha@learnemy.com or stania@thoughtworks.com and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Bjorn - Muthu - Yos - Lachlan - Jaryl - Justin Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Elisha (elisha@learnemy.com) and Tania (stania@thoughtworks.com).
events.location: ThoughtWorks, 87B Amoy Street #03/04, Singapore 069906

events.description: Hi Everyone. Factom (factom.org) founders are on a world tour, taking part in Inside Bitcoins and they would like to speak about the platform. Also since this will be right after the conference, it will be a good chance to debrief and have a chat about it. Bye! Tomas btw. for those who want to attend the conference and still don't have tickets, use "COINOFSALE" or "COINREPUBLIC" code to get 10% off.
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: ADVANCED R TRAINING by Jared Lander
events.description: The Revolution Analytics’ Center of Excellence (COE) is a collaboration with the Infocomm Development Authority of Singapore (IDA) to enable Singapore companies and professionals with training and expertise for big data analytics projects. We are pleased to host Professor Lander in Singapore from 2nd to 6th Feb 2015 for public class trainings and workshops. Jared P. Lander is a long-time Revolution Analytics consultant and collaborator, and the Founder and CEO of Lander Analytics. He is also the Organizer of the New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup and an Adjunct Professor of Statistics at Columbia University. With a masters from Columbia University in statistics and a bachelors from Muhlenberg College in mathematics, he has experience in both academic research and industry. He specializes in data management, multilevel models, machine learning, generalized linear models, data management, visualization and statistical computing. He is the author of R for Everyone, a book about R Programming geared toward Data Scientists and Non-Statisticians alike. The book is available from Amazon , Barnes & Noble and InformIT . The material is drawn from the classes he teaches at Columbia and is incorporated into his corporate training. Very active in the data community, Jared is a frequent speaker at conferences, universities and meetups around the world. He was a member of the 2014 Strata New York selection committee.
events.location: Revolution Analytics Singapore Office, 51 Changi Business Park Central 2 #04-09/10

events.name: Pre-Hackathon Workshop, Manpower Hackathon
events.description:
The Pre-Hackathon Workshop is a great opportunity for you to get a headstart for the Manpower Hackathon and immerse yourself in the themes with help from subject-matter experts.   
Learn from individuals working closely with local and foreign workers about the issues they face.  Use this to find out how your solutions can help empower these workers, making them aware of employment laws. Similarly, get an in-depth understanding of the opportunities available for technology-enabled tools to help instil the importance of WSH and design the Next Generation Work Pass.   
Insights into the themes will come in handy when building your solutions during the hackathon weekend! 
  
EVENT DETAILS 
Date: Tuesday, 3 February 2015 
Time: 6.30 - 9pm 
Venue: 237 South Bridge Road 
  
MORE INFORMATION 
Find out more about the Manpower Hackathon and workshop here.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

events.name: 3D Printing Excellence with CATIA V5
events.description:
Learn how to 3D design an mechanical component using CATIA Advanced Surface capabilities. Learn from the live demonstration how you can apply advanced techniques to create high quality, aesthetically pleasing and geometrically accurate Surface 3D CAD data. 
Be intrigued on how 3D printing can improve and enhance your business workflow both in time compression and cost savings, and understand how you can translate a concept into a physical prototype within hours. 
Gain insights from experienced professionals on the latest in 3D printing application and various post-process methods in converting your prototype for actual end-use.

This seminar is catered towards engineers, designers and business owners of all levels in the Aerospace as well as Precision Engineering industry. Join us at this exclusive event and uncover the different applications of 3D printing for you. 
Speakers 
  




  
Stanley Leung 
Pre-Sales & Application Manager 
Stratasys Singapore Pte Ltd 
  


Stanley Leung is the Pre-sales & Application Manager of South Asia, responsible for the technical sales support across the region of South East Asia, Australia and India to ensure sustainable implementation of 3D printing to the field. 
Prior to joining Stratasys, Stanley worked for a distributor under Objet AP Ltd. as a project executive, which owns various 3D printers including SLS, SLA, Objet, Zcorp and MLS in a period of 1.5 years. This is the start of his printing career. 
Stanley joined Objet AP Ltd. in 2011 and assumed the position of a Pre-Sales & Application Engineer for regions of Korea, Taiwan & Japan.  With vast experience on prospect visiting, 3d printing solution consultation and new application implement to the fields, Stanley developed a high-level of expertise and know-how with all that is related to company’s products and in-depth understanding on benefit of implementing  3D printing solution to industries. 
After the merger of Stratasys & Objet in December 2012, Stanley has played an important role in conducting numerous product & application training sessions to new partners. His contribution to strengthen penetration of 3D printing in the field had been recognized by the company and was assigned to be the Pre-sales Manager of South Asia in May 2014. 
Stanley holds a Bachelor Degree in Material Engineering from the Hong Kong City University. 
  




  
Sean Looi 
General Manager 
Creatz3D Pte Ltd. 
  


Sean Looi is the General Manager of Creatz3D Pte Ltd, the authorised distributor of Stratasys™ 3D printing systems and materials in Singapore, Vietnam and Indonesia. Creatz3D’s additive manufacturing solutions also includes Arcam™ for production of metal components as well as Materialise™ Rapid Prototyping Softwares. 
Despite majoring in MSc Finance, Sean’s passion in 3D printing opened the door of opportunity of distributing 3D printing technologies in 2007. His knowledge in various manufacturing practices placed him in favourable position to advice on advanced solutions for direct digital manufacturing. 
Sean’s accumulated technical experience with a variety of different 3D printing machines, technologies and applications, across all industry sectors, helped him to gain foresights into the macro economy of additive manufacturing potential. 
In return, Sean has been actively helping companies various sectors think more critically, innovate better to improve workflow and is highly respected in the local Additive Manufacturing committee. With over 6 years of experience in the industry, Sean is a regular invited keynote speaker in various local institutions and events. 
  




  
Sally Chuen 
Sales Manager, Singapore 
Creatz3D Pte Ltd. 


 Sally Chuen is the Sales Manager of Creatz3D Pte Ltd, an authorized distributor of Stratasys products in Singapore, Indonesia and Vietnam. She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration from the University of South Australia, as well as a background education in Chemical Process Technology. 
Sally’s 9 years of past sales experiences revolves around the distribution of equipment in the production and manufacturing industries. She further diversified her portfolio into various other industries following her inception into Creatz3D in 2012 to promote the adoption of Objet 3D Printers.   
In 2013, Sally took the company forward by driving the demand and adoption of additive manufacturing in Singapore. With her background and understanding of the market, Sally currently heads her sales team to advocate the applications of 3D Printing. 
Sally has vast knowledge in 3D printing technologies and their various applications, and she is no stranger to sharing her advices with audiences. 




  
Donald Koh 
Sales Director/Consultant 
TecMaven Group Pte Ltd 


Donald Koh is the Sales Director/Consultant with TecMaven Group Pte Ltd and has over 20 years of Technical Sales experience/knowledge across different Mechanical and Manufacturing software solutions.   
Previously a Mechanical/ Manufacturing Engineer, Donald has helped many companies across different industries with individual Mechanical and Manufacturing requirement. 
Together with Keith Tan, Senior Application Engineer with 14 years of CATIA experience at Tecmaven Group, they will be presenting the power of CATIA V5 Mechanical and Surface Design solution and as well as downstream application to 3D Printing. 




  
Who Should Attend 

3D CAD/CAM Designers
Automotive Engineers
Mechanical Engineers
Business Owners and Decision Makers

Terms and Conditions 

Online registration is required.
Each participant is allowed to order one (1) ticket only.
Registration closes on 3rd February 2015, or when seats are filled.
Organizers reserve the right to the final decision regarding all registration matters

Further information, contact Nigel at 9388 0512 to find out more. 
Alternatively, you can email info@creatz3d.com to inquire.

events.name: Creative Coding Meetup #4 - VJing & Creative Coding
events.description: Happy new year to all! Sorry for almost forgetting to hold a meetup this month, but we'll have exciting items for our upcoming one! We will also be holding our meetup at a new Zopim / Zendesk office! (Please check the address!) The plan for this meetup session is as follows: - Talk 1: "VJing" by Nozomu Miura - Talk 2? (Contact me if you're interested to speak) - Creative coding challenge break out session In the first talk, Nozomu Miura will be speaking about "VJing and creative coding". Nozomu is a Japanese software developer as well as a VJ working in Singapore. He also runs a company call http://techlife.sg/ He has written many software and it would be really interesting to know about stuff and applications he do. The second talk is still open for now, so feel free to come forward if you have anything to share. Finally we'll end with a creative coding challenge. I'll announce a challenge (which is to be decided) and we'll break out into groups trying to code that. At the end of the session, we'll present our works to other groups. So please bring your laptops if you would like to get your hands dirty. As always, remember to RSVP to estimate the amount of refreshments needed and hope to see you there!

This session is developed by Forum for the Future in partnership with ArtScience Museum. Featuring four speakers who bring different perspectives on the future: • Veerappan Swaminathan, Co-founder, Sustainable Living Lab • Tong Yee, Co-founder, The Thought Collective • Prof Dr Peter Edwards, Director, Singapore ETH Centre • Michelle Lim, Founder, Singapore National Ceramics Festival The session will be chaired by James Goodman, Director of Futures at Forum for the Future.

events.name: Succeeding with Digital Orthodontics
events.description:
Succeeding with Digital Orthodontics Stratasys, Dental Axess, QuantumLeap, and 3Shape are proud to invite you to an evening of Digital Orthodontics.  The world of orthodontics is changing and the number of orthodontists and laboratories going digital is increasing rapidly. During the evening, you will learn about digital impression taking, digital model storage, treatment analysis, treatment planning, treatment simulation, digital appliance design, case management and 3D printing. The event will be held at Q&M Dental Centre in City Square Mall. There will be a bus taking the participants from Marina Bay Sands (venue of the AOSC) to the dental centre.  Hosts 3Shape is a leading industry pacesetter and provider of 3D scanners and CAD/CAM software for dental professionals in clinics and labs. Stratasys is a leading global provider of 3D printing and additive manufacturing solutions. Dental Axess provides the Australian and New Zealand markets with a wide range of digital dental solutions. QuantumLeap is a leading provider for high quality dental equipment and accessories in Singapore.    
Program 6.00 pm - 7.00 pm: Registration, buffet and refreshments 7.00 pm - 7.10 pm: Welcome 7.10 pm - 9.00 pm: 3Shape’s orthodontics solutions by Rudy Labor, Application Specialist (Orthodontics), 3Shape 3D Printing for orthodontics by Dr Stephen Ong, Dental Associate Director, APJ, Stratasys The Whole Tooth Approach - High quality 3D orthodontic treatment solutions using state-of-the-art CAD/CAM technology by Ari Sciacca, Lab owner/Director of Archform Orthodontics,  Australia   
Speakers Rudy Labor is Application Specialist for 3Shape’s Orthodontics solutions. He has been with 3Shape for four years, and focuses exclusively on ortho. Before joining 3Shape Rudy Labor owned a lab in France. Rudy Labor has trained 100s of professionals around the world in how to benefit from digital orthodontics.  Dr Stephen Ong currently serves as the Dental Associate Director for Stratasys Asia Pacific and Japan. He received his Bachelor of Dental Science from the University of Western Australia and Masters of Business Administration from the University of Melbourne, Melbourne Business School. He has worked in private dental practices in Australia and Singapore and most recently was engaged with a large dental supplies company with a focus on clinical consumable products. Ari Sciacca is the owner of Archform Orthodontics in Australia. Archform Orthodontics is at the leading edge of orthodontic technology and serves orthodontists around the world. Ari Sciacca, has had a keen interest in digital technologies and has used them in his laboratory for more than ten years. Today, he uses 3D scanners, 3D printers and various orthodontics software. Archform also receives digital impressions from some of the orthodontists that they work with. 
 Welcome!
events.location: Q & M DENTAL Centre, City Square Mall, 180 Kitchener Road #b1-13/14, Singapore  208539

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm The Orchestra of Futurist Noise Intoners Directed by Luciano Chessa. A Performa commission 7.30pm & 8.45pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 Inspired by Leonardo da Vinci's mechanical noisemakers, Futurist painter and composer Luigi Russolo (1885–1947) developed an orchestra of hand-cranked instruments which he called Intonarumori. These first mechanical synthesizers produced by Russolo generated sounds of whirrs and buzzes, clangs, scrapes, sirens and mechanically plucked strings. In collaboration with the Italian Cultural Institute and Performa, ArtScience Museum presents two full performances by The Orchestra of Futurist Noise Intoners, an ensemble founded in 2009 by the Italian composer and conductor Luciano Chessa that performs on his replicas of Russolo's earliest Intonarumori orchestra. Each performance will be accompanied by a short talk by Chessa. The concert features musicians from YSTCM and LASALLE College of the Arts. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis. The full line-up of ArtScience Late until March 2015 can be viewed here: http://bit.ly/artsciencelate
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Cell Therapy Industry: What’s in it for Singapore?
events.description:
Cell Therapy Industry: What’s in it for Singapore? 
Adult stem cells have been the holy grail of Cell Therapy as evident in the successes of bone marrow transplant for leukaemia patients. In 2012, the Nobel Prize in Medicine was awarded to research on genetically induced adult stem cells for “advancing therapy”. This has led to the unprecedented growth in the arena of regenerative medicine using patients’ own cells. As we see a dwindling number of approved small molecule drugs and rising promises of biologics, can we ride on the wave of cell therapy as the next blockbuster or personalised therapeutics? Biotech Connection Singapore brings you a panel of key opinion figures in the Singapore cell therapy community, as we discuss the opportunities and challenges of translating stem cell research into clinical applications.    
-          Are our technologies ready to develop the ideal candidate for cell-based therapy possessing characteristics such as accessibility, ease of scaling up, long tern safety profile and autologous in nature, etc? 
-          In terms of business models, is Singapore going to stagnate at the level of cord blood banking instead of leading the frontier of cell therapy?  
-          Japan, Korea and China have emerged as the strong contenders in the development of cell therapy. Is our regulatory framework sufficiently established to administer cell therapy trials locally?  
-          How do we prevent non-compliant clinical practices which put desperate patients at risks? 
  
Programme 
6:30 – 7:00 PM               Registration 
 7:00 – 7:10 PM               BCS & Speaker Introduction   
7:10 – 8:30 PM               Panel Discussion and Q&A   
8:30 – 9:30 PM               Networking Reception 
  
Our Speakers 
  
Prof. James Hui  
Head & Senior Consultant, Division of Paediatric Orthopaedics 
Director, Cartilage Repair Program, National University Health System, Singapore 
  
  
  
Prof. James Hui specializes in the management of orthopaedic problems in children, as well as general orthopaedics. His special areas of interest are the care, rehabilitation and surgical treatment of musculoskeletal problems occurring in infants and children, such as hip dysplasia and dislocation, foot deformities, spinal deformities, limb length discrepancies and neuromuscular disorders such as Cerebral Palsy, Spina Bifida and Muscular Dystrophy. Prof. Hui completed his medical degree at the National University of Singapore. He subsequently completed his surgical and orthopaedic training at the National University Hospital, Singapore. He is a fellowship-trained paediatric orthopaedic surgeon, having spent a year in Australia on a paediatric orthopaedic fellowship. Prof Hui is actively involved in undergraduate and postgraduate teaching at NUS. He is a member of numerous professional societies including the Paediatric Orthopaedic Society of North America, the Asia Pacific Orthopaedic Association and the Singapore Medical Association. Prof Hui is actively involved in clinical and basic science research.  
  
  
Mr Kim David Raineri 
Business Director, Lonza Bioscience Singapore 
  
  
  
  
Kim David Raineri is the Business Director for Lonza Bioscience Singapore Pte Ltd.  He is currently responsible for the ongoing operations of Lonza’s Cell Therapy contract manufacturing operation in Singapore  Prior to this position, he was the Director of Operations for Lonza Walkersville (Maryland USA), where he managed multiple operations at the site including Cell Therapy contract manufacturing, manufacturing of  Endotoxin detection (LAL) testing kits, powdered and liquid cell culture media, and other research products marketed under brand names Biowhittaker™, Clonetics™, and Poietics™.  Prior to Lonza, he was with CryoLife Inc. (Georgia USA) as the Senior Manager of the Tissue Processing Lab.  In this role, he was responsible for daily operations of human allograft manufacturing including human heart valves, vascular and orthopedic grafts.  Kim Raineri has a Master’s of Business Administration from Kennesaw State University and Bachelors of Science from University of Miami.  
  
  
Dr. Steve Oh 
Senior Principal Scientist, Bioprocessing Technology Institute 
Vice President, International Society of Cell Therapy (ISCT) Asia 
  
  
  
Steve Oh, Ph.D.  is the Senior Principal Scientist of the Stem Cell Group at the Bioprocessing Technology Institute (BTI), A*STAR. He has devoted his career to transforming stem cell bioprocesses from the petri dish to controlled bioreactors. The team now has a broad range of expertise in the production of human stem cells as therapeutic medicines; these include mesenchymal stem cells, pluripotent (induced and embryonic) stem cells, neuroprogenitors, cardiomyocytes, bone and cartilage differentiation and red blood cells. Current issues include creating robust serum free media for microcarrier cultures of these stem and differentiated cells; fashioning biodegradable microcarriers for transplantation and integrating the cell expansion process with complex multi-stage differentiation. He is also the Vice President Elect of the International Society of Cell Therapy (ISCT) Asia where he is involved in growing the society’s influence through educational technical webinars, policy making, conference organisation and increased participation of Asian scientists in cell therapy research and applications. Steve is also the Director of the Bioprocess Internship Programme which trains a cadre of highly skilled staff for the Biologics & Cell Therapy industry in Singapore.

events.name: Learning Haskell and using Yesod as a production API backend by @Calvin Cheng
events.description: Haskell is an obscure language in comparison with other popular languages/frameworks like python/django, ruby/rails, javascript/nodejs and is usually not considered in 'mainstream' start-up projects. I decided to take a look and found it an impressive language that I am comfortable using, for a new production app in my company. Our current app uses golang for the API backend. I would like to share my experiences (and pain :-p) learning the language and why I am happy with it as our API backend for a new app.

events.name: Big Data for Social Good Challenge (See Details for Start/End)
events.description: THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE BEGINS NOVEMBER 10, 2014 AND CONTINUES TO MARCH 3, 2015. CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service . Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found. Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded.... Register here: http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/ What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix. Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page . The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size. Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets !
events.location: Big Data for Social Good Challenge, Web only, Singapore

events.description: Big Data conference is a platform for Singapore leading analytic and business intelligence leaders to address the challenges and tap on the opportunities in leveraging Big Data in this unique market. It is a marketplace for the regional business leaders and IT executives to access the very best of ideas & technologies in adopting and improving big data and analytic practices and strategies. Theme: Driving Business Success Big Data Conference focus on:- - Deciphering the haystack - Semantic Web Technology Travel Planner Application (Approach for modernizing tourism domain using technology) - Panel Discussion - Why Big Data is relevant for IT? - Big data and Hadoop masterclass tutorial - Big Data Innovation Read more Benefits of attending - This event concentrates on practical applications and exploitation of big data. - It aims to cut through the marketing hype and help participants understand - The pro's and con's of the new and powerful analytic tools (both open source and proprietary) - security & governance issues and special areas of application - Emerging challenges for CIO’s and information professionals. - What are the skills set required? Why Implement Big Data? Big Data - Accelerate your business - Re-develop your products - Perform risk analysis - Keeping your data safe - Create new revenue streams - Customize your website in real time - Reducing maintenance costs - Offering enterprise-wide insights For more detail click here Registration fee for conference Registration fee: USD $399 Discounted fee: USD $ 350 For online registration click here For offline registration, please send the following details to [masked] Name | Email ID | Contact No | Designation | Organization Name For this meet up group 10% discount on registration fee
events.location: Village Hotel Changi,  1 Netheravon Road Singapore 508502

events.name: Lets meet at Cloud Conference in Singapore
events.description: Cloud computing continues to be the way of the future and many studies indicate that more than 50% of all information technology will be in this new paradigm within the next five to ten years. This transformation has great implications for emerging markets which have the potential to leap frog mature markets in their adoption of cloud computing, combine cloud computing and mobile technologies to introduce unique services that can transform the lives of billions, drive a much larger scale of adoption and challenge existing price points, while presenting unique challenges in areas such as security and user interfaces to cloud computing. Theme : Cloud Computing: Opportunities, Issues, and Challenges & Big Data Innovation: Driving Business Success. Key Topics - Cloud Computing- Mindset, Business and Technology Chang - Designing Infrastructure for Enterprises on Public Cloud - Panel Discussion : Sharing Resources on cloud value - - - Development Model and Environment for Dynamic Mobile Cloud Services - Security of Virtual Working on Cloud Computing Platform - Local Authentication and Authorization System for Immediate Setup of Cloud Environments - Cloud Champions League, Switzerland - Final Corporate Quiz Benefits of attending • Increased speed in responding to unforeseen events. • Easy to get the latest and greatest updates. • Adoption is quick and simple. • Improved information security. • Deployment time decreases from years to months. Audience for the Conference 2014 (Not limited to) Heads of Business Development, Strategy Directors, Directors, Telecommunication Managers, Communication Directors, Heads of Sales, Heads of Call and Contact Managers, VPs of Technology, Product Managers, Business Development Managers, Storage Managers, Business Analysts For More detail click here Registration fee for conference Registration fee: USD $399 Discounted fee: USD $ 350 For online registration click here For offline registration, please send the following details to [masked] Name | Email ID | Contact No | Designation | Organization Name For this meet up group 10% discount on registration fee
events.location: Village Hotel Changi,  1 Netheravon Road Singapore 508502

events.name: Lets meet at Internet of Things in Singapore
events.description: Our Conferences focuses on latest happening in IoT and how the Internet of Things will re-shape our interactions with the real and virtual worlds in the coming years. This Conference brings together leading IoT companies, Start-Ups and the developer/ Professional community to exchange their ideas with the practical application and utilization of Internet of Things. This event shall provide you the opportunity to meet IoT experts, Start Ups, attend keynote presentation and interactive sessions and network with experienced Business and Technical practitioners and Start Ups in the area of IoT. Theme: Link your World", exploring the latest happening in IoT Industry and how the Internet of Things will offer businesses and consumers. IoT Conference focus on:- - Keynote: Everywhere, Everything & Everyone - How IoT Platform & Knowledge Graphics are Changing the Way We Live & Work - Convergence of Network, Services & Devices: Regulatory & Policy Framework -Software Frameworks and Environment for IoT - Internet of Things as a key Technology Accelerator -?How Mobility Transform Your Business with IoT - Radio Spectrum for the IoT: a Critical Challenge - How to Identify Patterns for Machine-to-Machine Solutions with the Cloud - Central Monitoring and Troubleshooting of IoT Networks: Meeting the SLA Challenge For agenda click here Why Implementing the Internet of Things - Greater visibility into operations: The biggest benefit to implementing IoT is greater visibility into machine operation and plant performance. Industries have been collecting massive amounts of data for years, but it’s been a challenge to analyze this data so that it can lead to actionable items. - M2M: integral step to IoT: One of the ways to see how IoT is becoming a reality is by looking at machine-to-machine (M2M) technologies. M2M refers to machines communicating directly to other equipment without any human intervention, usually through real-time controllers and HMIs. M2M is also an integral step in the development of IoT. - Leveraging existing technologies for interoperability - Tangible results - Benefits from the cloud Benefits of Internet of things • Tracking behavior for real-time marketing; • Enhanced situational awareness; • Sensor-driven decision analytics; • Process optimization; • Optimized resource consumption; and • Instantaneous control and response in complex autonomous systems. • Ubiquitous networks • Connected computing • Ubiquitous sensors • Intelligence at the periphery of the network • Analytics-as-a-Service • Marketing automation • Supply Chain Analytics Audience for the Conference 2014 (Not limited to) - Start-Up in IoT and M2M, and have any product to showcase or any idea to share. - Venture Capitalist, and want to support IoT Start-Ups. - Professional, and works in the area of IoT and M2M - Researcher and want to see latest happening in the area of IoT. - Student and want to enhance your knowledge. For More detail click here Registration fee for conference Registration fee: USD $399 Discounted fee: USD $ 350 For online registration click here For offline registration, please send the following details to [masked] Name | Email ID | Contact No | Designation | Organization Name For this meet up group 10% discount on registration fee
events.location: Village Hotel Changi,  1 Netheravon Road Singapore 508502

events.name: Front End TL;DR March 2015
events.description: Let's visit migme, a startup that has been around forever and is currently reinventing itself as a social entertainment destination, complete with IPO and fresh funding from Foxconn last year. Come to learn about the host company but more importantly to learn front end tech technology. FEDS aims to showcase startups doing cool front end work, but also to sharpen our skills. We will split up into small teams, pick a topic of interest (e.g. library, framework, tool) and collaborate on it for an hour or so. Then present our findings for the common good, and the most interesting team wins a fabulous prize! Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.
events.location: Migme Hq

events.name: Hub 2015 Singapore
events.description:
We’re happy to announce Anaplan is bringing our popular Hub World Tour event to Singapore in 2015.  
Join business leaders from a wide range of hyper-growth companies from across the Asia Pacific region in Singapore at Hub 15. This exclusive industry event brings together business planning professionals for an intimate opportunity to share best practices and actionable insights. Whether your domain is Sales, Operations, Finance, or HR, attend Hub 15 to network with your peers and discover new ways you can use Anaplan to improve your business planning and grow your company. 
Click here for more information. 
  
Date and Location 
Date: Wednesday, 18th March, 2015 Venue: RedDot Design Museum Singapore – Gallery 1 and Gallery 2 Address: 28 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069120
events.location: RedDot Design Museum Singapore – Gallery 1 and Gallery 2, 28 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069120

events.name: Front End TL;DR April 2015
events.description: We are being hosted by Smartkarma, a young startup disrupting the financial industry. They are located in Changi Business Park (Expo MRT) because that's where most financial institutions have their IT operations. FEDS is about hands-on, collaborative learning. Join the session if you'd like to learn new front end technology. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.
events.location: Smartkarma

events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: The search for Singapore's worst robot will take place some time this year (most likely in July 2015). Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. Preparations are being made to bring this quirky robotic competition to Singapore. We are looking for venue hosts, sponsors, contributors and supporters for this inaugural event. More details about guidelines and rules of competition will be announced in March 2015. Meanwhile stay cute and unskillful! If you're interested to participate, please indicate your attendance here. Thank you. *the date indicated below is a tentative one. the confirmed schedule will be release in Mar 2015 For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
events.location: TBD
